The creation of the Wisconsin Economic D: WEDC) in 2011 by Gov. Scott Walker as a quasi-private agency to spearhead job creation.
The scathing audit in 2013: which highlighted staffing turmoil and issues within WEDC.
The claim made by Mary Burke: Walker's Democratic challenger, that WEDC is not using the funds appropriated to it.
The report from the nonpartisan Legislat: which stated that WEDC had a surplus of about $18 million and had a budget of about $95 million.
